column4: hm, i have a solitary white pixel on my panel which acts like an applet (as in, it gets moved along when moving around applets), but cant be removed or moved by its own
its there in a standard UNR installation
that white pixel is there for everybody it seems, as i can find it on screenshots on the net
http://digitizor.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/11/ubuntu-karmic-unr-first-start.png <== between the wireless tray icon and the clock
kyle: but its not part of the clock. when you move the clock around or remove the clock from the panel the pixel is still there
kyle: i love the tabbed browsing and icon-only switcher, i kinda like the launcher but its buggy as hell, and i just wish they would get their act together
there are some good netbook remixes ,but what netbook do you own???
and before anyone recommends using eeebuntu or easypeasy or whatever... there is absolutely no reason to use those instead of regular UNR imho
as all the bugs and annoyances are present
then asus eee pc Easy Peasy was built for that and jolicloud also claims to be working on most netbooks right out the box
i did manage to change the most annoying thing about the unr launcher, which is the ridiculously high icon distance
depends on screen size also you can get ubuntu with moblin
yeah, no major surgery to get mine to work either, most things work fine ootb
its all just customizing stuff - the main reason i like UNR is because the screen is TINY (6.4" 800x480) and the touchpad is useless
if its screen resolution Moblin would be the way to go
